summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Ghislaine Maxwell's counsel regarding the return of a superseding indictment by a grand jury in Manhattan. The letter attaches the indictment and proposes times to discuss discovery issues, supplemental briefing on pretrial motions, and other matters in light of the new charges.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the referenced criminal case US v. Maxwell, S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), for whom a superseding indictment was returned.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: The prosecutor who sent the letter to Maxwell's counsel, representing the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Comey, as an AUSA, is prosecuting Maxwell in the criminal case, as indicated by the official correspondence regarding the superseding indictment.

events.title: Superseding Indictment Returned
events.description: A grand jury sitting in Manhattan returned a superseding indictment in the case US v. Maxwell, S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).

keyFacts: A superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell was returned by a grand jury in Manhattan on March 29, 2021.
The prosecution, represented by AUSA Maurene Comey, is initiating discussions with Maxwell's defense counsel regarding discovery and pretrial motions in light of the new charges.
The document is official correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the defense team.
